Audio Managers

Sound effects and music in code are implemented as .AudioManager objects. You can access these audio managers with the following code:

sfxMgr = base.sfxManagerList[0]
musicMgr = base.musicManager

In ~builtins.base, sfxManagerList <direct.showbase.ShowBase.ShowBase.sfxManagerList> is a list of .AudioManager objects intended to be used for sound effects, and musicManager <direct.showbase.ShowBase.ShowBase.musicManager> is an .AudioManager object intended to be used for music.

Each .AudioManager object can have 16 different sounds cached at a given time. This value is actually set as the audio-cache-limit in the panda config.prc (found in your install directory) and can be changed.

python

By default, base.musicManager <direct.showbase.ShowBase.ShowBase.musicManager> has a limit of 1 concurrent sound, however. This limit can be explicitly increased using the following code:

# Allow playing two music files at the same time.
base.musicManager.setConcurrentSoundLimit(2)
